page.title: 07PLAYGROUND GAMES
page.content: These games are played for{recreation There is a game we play in the{Autumn when the conkers fall off the trees. {Conkers}are the fruit-seed of the Horse-Chestnut tree. You collect the conkers and pierce a hole through them. Then you thread a piece of string through and take turns at hitting each others conker. The surviving conker is the winner. {BALL DAB.}Everyone stands in a circle with their legs open and 1 person has a ball. The person with the ball drops it in the middle of the circle and whoevers legs it rolls through they are allowed to run with the ball and try and hit someone with the ball below the neck. If they do then that person has to help get all the others in the same way without running.
